intro: Cirrhopetalum campanulatum, commonly known as the bell-shaped cirrhopetalum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural collections, though it is not widely commercially available.
